channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Australian Field Hockey Player Amputates Finger to Play in Paris Olympics
item.description: After the tip of his ring finger was mangled in a practice match two weeks ago, Matthew Dawson chose amputation over a long, uncertain recovery.

item.title: Gaza’s Death Toll Was Largely Accurate in Early Days of War, Study Finds
item.description: Though the war has clearly devastated the civilian population, the credibility of the Gazan Health Ministry’s toll has been a subject of debate.

item.title: Japan is planning the biggest minimum wage hike since it set a pay floor in 1978
item.description: Higher minimum wages will likely particularly benefit low-income households, which are most affected by ongoing inflation.

item.title: Biden Says It’s Time for ‘Fresh Voices,’ and Netanyahu Defends Israel
item.description: Plus, the illicit flow of technology to Russia.

item.title: Australian Field Hockey Player Amputates Finger to Play in Paris Olympics
item.description: After the tip of his ring finger was mangled in a practice match two weeks ago, Matthew Dawson chose amputation over a long, uncertain recovery.

item.title: Rupert Murdoch is going to court to push his 3 more liberal kids out of his Fox and News Corp media empires
item.description: Court documents show Murdoch wants to give more voting rights to his conservative son, and CEO of Fox, Lachlan.

item.title: Netanyahu’s Speech to Congress: Key Takeaways
item.description: Here are six takeaways from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s speech to U.S. lawmakers.

item.title: Kremlin Uses Olympic Ban as Another Arrow to Shoot at the West
item.description: Only 15 athletes from Russia will compete at the Paris Games, under a “neutral” designation. The Kremlin is framing the ban as part of its showdown with Western adversaries.

item.title: Nestle ‘still in repairing mode’ warns CEO Mark Schneider, as Swiss giant lowers sales outlook and seeks to lure cost-conscious customers back
item.description: Nestle could face pressure to cut costs more aggressively and consider whether acquisitions or disposals are needed to drive profitability.

item.title: China Unexpectedly Cuts Interest Rate as World Markets Sag
item.description: The central bank lowered a key rate in its latest effort to steady China’s economy, as Asian stock markets followed Wall Street down.

item.title: In Burkina Faso, ‘Nowhere Is Safe’ from Terrorists or Troops
item.description: The West African nation of Burkina Faso was once known for its lively arts scene. Now, it is a country torn apart by Islamist extremists and the government’s brutal effort to drive them out.

item.title: Wells Fargo won’t renew the Philadelphia sports arena naming deal it’s had since 2010
item.description: Neither team that uses the arena—the 76ers and the Flyers—has won a championship in over 40 years.

item.title: Trump and His Allies Adapt to a New Role: Fighting for Attention
item.description: In the days since President Biden ended his re-election bid and passed the torch to Vice President Kamala Harris, Donald Trump’s campaign has been crowded out of the headlines.

item.title: Typhoon Gaemi Heads for China as Cargo Ship Sinks Off Taiwan
item.description: Nine sailors were missing after a cargo ship sank near the island. The storm was forecast to make landfall in China on Thursday.

item.title: Stellantis profits halve amid massive drop in sales as carmaker reveals plans to revive old models
item.description: Net income fell 48% to €5.6 billion in the first half, missing the €7 billion average estimate.
